To the degree that active policy was involved, it was clearlypolicy aimed at encouraging recovery, not policy responding to a recovery thatwas already under way. Together with the discussion of the role of politicalinstability in causing gold flows, these findings make it clear that theincrease in the money supply in the recovery phase of the Great Depression wasnot endogenous.
